intro: Hansteinia, commonly known as the pink hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Hansteinia species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
